greenmirror.client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenmirror.GreenMirrorController
      • greenmirror.client.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer

    public class Client
extends GreenMirrorController
implements Observer
    The controller on the client side. It handles nearly everything, from the connection with the server to the tracking of the model.
    Author:
    Karim El Assal

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        Creates a new Client controller. It registers any available ModelInitializers, TraceSelectors and CommandHandlers.

    • Method Detail

      • getHelpMessage

        public @NonNull String getHelpMessage()
        Description copied from class: GreenMirrorController
        Gets the help message that is associated with the command line usage of the application. The first %s will be replaced by the help screen generated by JOpt Simple.
        Specified by:
        getHelpMessage in class GreenMirrorController
        Returns:
        the help message
        See Also:
        HelpCommandLineOptionHandler

      • getTransitions

        public @NonNull List<ModelTransition> getTransitions()
        Returns:
        the available transitions as defined by the model initializer

      • getTransitions

        public @NonNull List<ModelTransition> getTransitions(@NonNull String traceTransition)
        Parameters:
        traceTransition - a transition from a trace
        Returns:
        all ModelInitializers that would execute from traceTransition

      • getModelInitializers

        public @NonNull List<ModelInitializer> getModelInitializers()
        Returns:
        all registered ModelInitializers

      • getTraceSelectors

        public @NonNull List<TraceSelector> getTraceSelectors()
        Returns:
        all registered TraceSelectors

      • addNode

        public void addNode(@NonNull Node node)
        Adds a Node to the visualizer and sets the unique id of the node accordingly. It also starts observing the node for changes. If the node is already added, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        node - the new Node

      • addRelation

        public void addRelation(@NonNull Relation relation)
        Adds a Relation to the visualizer and to the model. After some validity checks, it adds the relation via Node.addRelation(Relation). This means that if relation is a placement relation, it replaces the previous placement relation.
        Parameters:
        relation - the new relation with both nodes set and both nodes should be known to the controller (this Client instance)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if one of the two nodes of the relation is null or one of the two nodes isn't known to the controller

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode(@NonNull Node node)
        Removes a Node from the visualizer. It is actually replaced by a NullNode so no issues occur with the indices of NodeList and ids of nodes. The server will be notified and will handle the removal of relations in its own way.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to remove

      • removeRelation

        public void removeRelation(Relation relation)
        Removes a Relation and notifies the server. If relation is null, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        relation - the relation to remove

      • connect

        public void connect(InetAddress host,
                    int port)
             throws SocketTimeoutException,
                    IOException
        Connects to the server. If port is not between 0 and 65535, we just return. This can be used for debug purposes. If the connection was established succesfully, a new PeerListener thread is started to listen for incoming data.
        Parameters:
        host - the address of the server
        port - the port on which the server should be listening (between 0 and 65535)
        Throws:
        SocketTimeoutException - if the connection to the server timed out
        IOException - if something went wrong with creating the streams

      • initializeModel

        public void initializeModel(@NonNull List<ModelInitializer> initializers)
        Initializes the model using all passed ModelInitializers.
        Parameters:
        initializers - the ModelInitializer instances

      • validateTrace

        public List<String> validateTrace(@NonNull TraceSelector selector)
        Validates the transitions on the trace given by selector by checking if there is registered ModelTransition available.
        Parameters:
        selector - the trace supplier
        Returns:
        a list of invalid transitions; null if all transitions on the trace are valid

      • executeTrace

        public void executeTrace(@NonNull TraceSelector traceSelector)
        Executes the trace. If the ModelTransition's Closure returns boolean false, further state-transitions are cancelled.
        Parameters:
        traceSelector - the TraceSelector that selects the trace

      • update

        public void update(Observable observable,
                   Object cmd)
        Receives updates from the objects it's observing. In practice, these only are the GreenMirror Nodes. If they have sent an update to this method, it means they want the server to know about a change in the model. In that case, this method forwards the received Command.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer
        Parameters:
        observable - the object it's observing
        cmd - the object the observable passed

      • initializeVisualizer

        public void initializeVisualizer(double width,
                                 double height,
                                 double duration,
                                 boolean rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly)
        Lets the server know with what parameters to initialize the visualizer. This has to be done as the first command and is the responsibility of the ModelInitializer implementations.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas
        height - the height of the canvas
        duration - the default duration of transitions; -1 for unspecified duration.
        rotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly - see Visualizer.isRotateRigidlyRelatedNodesRigidly()

      • handlePeerData

        public void handlePeerData(@NonNull String data,
                           CommandHandler handler)
        Handles data received from the peer. In the current version of GreenMirror, no data is received from the peer, but this could be possible in future versions.
        Specified by:
        handlePeerData in class GreenMirrorController
        Parameters:
        data - the received data
        handler - the command handler that has been matched with the data

      • main

        public static void main(@NonNull String[] args)
        The main entry point for the GreenMirror client. All available options are explained if --help or -? is passed.
        Parameters:
        args - the passed command line options
